author: By ISABEL KERSHNER, FARES AKRAM and RICK GLADSTONE
title: Israeli Leader Says He Feels No Pressure to Quit Bombing Gaza

abstract: Mr. Horn, a flutist and saxophonist, departed from mainstream jazz to create mellow, meditative recordings.
article: Paul Horn, a Founding Father of New Age Music, Dies at 84
author: By PETER KEEPNEWS
title: Paul Horn, a Founding Father of New Age Music, Dies at 84

abstract: With refining eroding into a money-losing area for most European players, Exxon Mobil is making a contrarian bet by expanding diesel production.
article: Betting on Diesel Cars, Exxon Is Set to Expand Belgium Refinery
author: By STANLEY REED
copyright: Tom Jamieson for The New York Times
title: Betting on Diesel Cars, Exxon Is Set to Expand Belgium Refinery

abstract: The investigations follow reports that scores of documents relating to child abuse in official circles went missing at the Home Office in the 1980s.
article: Britain to Investigate Allegations of Sexual Abuse Cover-Up Decades Ago
author: By ALAN COWELL
title: Britain to Investigate Allegations of Sexual Abuse Cover-Up Decades Ago

abstract: General Motors OnStar system provides streams of data about the performance of G.M. vehicles, but the automaker says little about how it uses this information to investigate problems.
article: G.M. OnStar Data Has Potential as Safety Tool
author: By AARON M. KESSLER
copyright: Daniel Acker/Bloomberg News, via Getty Images
title: G.M. OnStar Data Has Potential as Safety Tool

abstract: The Bridge explores United States-Mexico border issues through the lens of a murder mystery on FX.
article: An Odd Couple Returns, Still Bound by a Border
author: By MIKE HALE
title: An Odd Couple Returns, Still Bound by a Border

abstract: The actor and comedian Tracy Morgan remained in critical condition on Sunday after he was injured in a crash in New Jersey over the weekend.
article: Tracy Morgan, Still Critical, Is More Responsive
author: By EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS
title: Tracy Morgan, Still Critical, Is More Responsive

abstract: The Mercedes-Benz Future Truck 2025 shown in eastern Germany is designed to steer itself at highway speeds, but allows a driver to intervene.
article: Daimler Demonstrates a Self-Driving Truck
author: By MELISSA EDDY
copyright: Gordon Welters for The New York Times
title: Daimler Demonstrates a Self-Driving Truck

abstract: Since the so-called Arab Spring, a new militancy has arisen, beckoning Muslims in Britain and other parts of the West to join the ranks of the holy warriors.
article: British Combatants of a Different Religious War
author: By ALAN COWELL
copyright: Philip Toscano/Press Association, via Associated Press
title: British Combatants of a Different Religious War

abstract: Despite nearly universal criticism in Iraq, and pressure from friendly nations to step down, Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki announced, I will not give up my candidacy.
article: Iraqi Premier to Run for a Third Term
author: By ALISSA J. RUBIN
copyright: Bryan Denton for The New York Times
title: Iraqi Premier to Run for a Third Term
